Rule: Being married or divorced increases the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Having a higher education level (Masters or Assoc) can increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.

While working more hours (e.g., 57 hours per week) can increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year, maintaining the same hours per week (40 hours) with changes in other factors (like marital status) can also improve the outcome.
